channel.title: UAEinteract.com - News
channel.description: Latest news from the United Arab Emirates

item.title: Liechtenstein's Prime Minister receives Abdullah bin Zayed
item.description:
Vaduz - Liechtenstein's Prime Minister Klaus Tschutscher received here Foreign Minister H.H. Sheikh Abdullah bin Zayed Al Nahyan at the headquarters of the government in the capital, Vaduz.

item.title: RCA has become a driving force for humanitarian work worldwide: Hamdan

item.title: Masdar Institute led initiative provides platform to nurture the brightest young talent
item.description: The Young Future Energy Leaders (YFEL), an initiative led by the Masdar Institute of Science and Technology, held a highly successful program during the World Future Energy Summit (WFES), in Abu Dhabi. This year, nearly 100 YFEL nominees took part in

item.title: UK-UAE Taskforce holds 3rd meeting in London
item.description: The third meeting of the UK-UAE Taskforce took place at the Foreign and Commonwealth Office in London on 31 January 2011. The meeting was hosted by Alistair Burt MP, Minister for the Middle East and South Asia, at the UK's Foreign and Commonwealth Of

item.title: Preparations for IDEX2011 underway
item.description: The organising committees of the 2011 edition of the International Defence Exhibition and Conference (IDEX) has held a meeting to review preparations for the forthcoming event which is being organised by Abu Dhabi National Exhibitions Company in coop

item.title: UAE's National Bank of Abu Dhabi closes 28 branches in Egypt
item.description:
The National Bank of Abu Dhabi, or NBAD, announced closure of all of its 28 branches in Egypt in line with the Central Bank of Egypt instructions from Egypt's central bank.
NBAD, in an emailed statement, said "We are committed to our people and

item.title: NBAD expects 10% rise in this year's profit
item.description: National Bank of Abu Dhabi's (NBAD) operating profits are expected to rise 10 per cent this year compared to last year, NBAD group chief executive officer Michael Tomalin told Gulf News in a telephone interview on Tuesday, shortly after the bank anno

item.title: Etihad signs-up to renowned global CSR organisation
item.description: Etihad Airways has become a member of "Business in the Community" (BITC), an organisation that will support the implementation of the Abu Dhabi-based airline's sustainability strategy and provide access to best practice in the field of corporate soci

item.title: Emirates enhances its northern European network
item.description:
Emirates is strengthening its operations in Northern Europe by adding more flights to Austria and Germany on the back of new route announcements into Switzerland and Denmark.
Four extra flights will be added to the airline's daily service to Vie

item.title: Dh1.5b Mussafah channel project becomes reality
item.description:
The Abu Dhabi Urban Planning Council (UPC) officially handed over the Dh1.5 billion Mussafah channel project to the Abu Dhabi Ports Company (ADPC) on Tuesday.
The new channel replaces the existing access channel to the Mussafah Industrial Area.

item.title: UAE tops GCC M&A deals in January
item.description: Aldar topped the region''s M&A and private placement deals in January, as the government rushed to save the beleaguered property firm. Overall, the UAE led the merger and acquisition transactions in the GCC, both in terms of value and in number.

item.title: Four stations set up to monitor seabed
item.description:
Four monitoring stations have been set up on the seabed between Fujairah and Dibba to help protect the natural environment.
This project aims at maintaining the coral reefs and protecting marine rocks, shells and coloured oysters mainly from dre

item.title: Dubai Customs officers foil bid to smuggle counterfeit 804 thousand dollars
item.description:
An attempt to smuggle US$804,000 (Dh2.9 million) of fake US$100 notes through Dubai International Airport has been foiled by Dubai Customs officers last Wednesday 26 January 2011.
Ali Al Mugahwi, Director of the Passengers Operations Department

item.title: Opening of Al Ain Aerobatic Show 2011 postponed to next Thursday
item.description:
Due to the adverse weather conditions being experienced across the United Arab Emirates, the organisers of the 2011 Al Ain Aerobatic Show have postponed the opening of the show on Wednesday 2nd February.

item.title: UAE President calls Egyptian President Mubarak
item.description: President His Highness Sheikh Khalifa Bin Zayed Al Nahyan expressed his utmost confidence in Egypt''s ability to overcome the current situation to once again prosper in security and stability. This came during a telephone call made by Sheikh Khalifa

item.title: UNHCR cooperates with IHC on Aid and Humanitarian Organisations in UAE

item.title: UNHCR launches 2011 Regional Response Plan for Iraqi refugees in Abu Dhabi
item.description: Following the launch of the first Regional Response Plan for Iraqi Refugees 2010 in Syria last year, the United Nations Refugee Agency UNHCR is launching the 2011 Regional Response Plan for Iraqi Refugees from Abu-Dhabi next Wednesday, 2 February 201

item.title: UAE films on special YouTube channel
item.description: The National Media Council (NMC) has established a special channel on YouTube to showcase many of the films that it has supported over the past decade. The channel, named 'Films on UAE', includes extracts from award-winning favourites produced with s

item.title: UAE-Egypt flight service to be normal
item.description:
Flights between UAE and Egypt will see normal operations as local carriers monitor rioting situation in the country as Egyptians revolt against the government.
With two daily flights to Cairo and four weekly flights to Alexandria, UAE''s nationa

item.title: Malaysian Prime Minister recognises Masdar as a driving force in development of a global sustainable industry
item.description:
The Prime Minister of Malaysia, Najib Tun Razak, yesterday visited the Masdar Institute campus at Masdar City, to see firsthand the momentum and progress of Abu Dhabi's world-renowned, sustainable and cutting-edge urban development.
The Prime M

item.title: UAE, Malaysia discuss ways to promote trade
item.description: UAE Minister of Foreign Trade Sheikha Lubna Al Qasimi and Malaysian Minister of International Trade '&' Industry Mustafa Mohamed have held a meeting in Abu Dhabi to discuss ways to promote Malaysian investments in the new sectors of the UAE economy.

item.title: Dana Gas fourth-quarter profit beats expectations
item.description:
The UAE's gas company Dana Gas yesterday posted fourth-quarter profits of Dh59 million, beating analysts' expectations due to increased output from Egypt and Iraq and higher fuel prices.
Full year results showed an increase of 40 per cent in rev

item.title: Statoil eyes re-licensing rounds in Abu Dhabi
item.description:
Statoil, Norway's biggest oil producer, plans to challenge Abu Dhabi National Oil Co's existing partners such as ExxonMobil Corp and Royal Dutch Shell for a role in the UAE's resources.

item.title: DFM announces full readiness to introduce "Delivery versus Payment" before the end of Q1 2011
item.description: Dubai Financial Market announced yesterday its full readiness to introduce the new settlement mechanism "Delivery versus Payment" (DvP). DFM has completed all the technical requirements to apply DvP in coordination with custodians and brokerage firms

item.title: UAE financial system is safe: Central Bank
item.description:
The Central Bank of UAE on Monday asked all financial institutions in the country to immediately report any suspicious money transactions or cases they come across to its Anti-money Laundering and Suspicious Cases Unit (AMLSCU).

item.title: Abu Dhabi hotel guests exceed target by 8%
item.description: Almost 1.8 million people stayed in Abu Dhabi's 114 hotels and hotel apartments last year � an increase of 18 per cent over 2009, according to the latest figures from the Abu Dhabi Tourism Authority (ADTA). Abu Dhabi also beat its hotel guest target

item.title: ADEC launches private education strategy to drive long-term Improvement in private school sector

item.title: ADACH hosts Logos Hope ship visit to Abu Dhabi
item.description:
The Abu Dhabi Authority for Culture and Heritage (ADACH) is hosting the M V Logos Hope ship visit to Abu Dhabi from 7 to 19 February 2011 under the patronage of Sheikh Sultan Bin Tahnoun Al Nahyan, Chairman of (ADACH).

item.title: 16th Abu Dhabi Terry Fox Run Confirmed for February 18
